title: Strict
summary: In mathematical writing, the term strict refers to the property of excluding equality and equivalence[1] and often occurs in the context of inequality and monotonic functions.[2] It is often attached to a technical term to indicate that the exclusive meaning of the term is to be understood. The opposite is non-strict, which is often understood to be the case but can be put explicitly for clarity. In some contexts, the word "proper" can also be used as a mathematical synonym for "strict".
